alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 7:29PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Umatilla and southeastern Walla Walla Counties through 800 PM PDT... At 728 PM PDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over Walla Walla, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walla Walla, College Place, Milton-Freewater, Dixie, Garrett and Kooskooskie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
